name: github_scenario_add_a_workflow_for_customer_with_create_update_del
description: Test case for: As a user, I want to add a workflow for Customer with create, update, delete transitions.

parts.text: add a workflow for Customer with create, update, delete transitions.

Thank you for the request. To get started, we need to set up the repository first. We follow a **GitOps practice**, which means the repo isn't just for code—it's the anchor for your entire project. Setting it up now ensures that every design choice and configuration we make next has a permanent home immediately.

I see you want to add a Customer workflow with create, update, and delete transitions. Before I generate or save any workflow artifacts, we need to initialize the repository and branch so the repository becomes the single source of truth for the changes. Choosing the project language and whether this will use a Public Cyoda template or your Private repo will determine the template and branch strategy I use.

Please choose how you'd like to set up the repo and branch so I can proceed.

[options-single-choice: Python — Public repo — New Branch, Python — Public repo — My Existing Branch, Python — Private repo — New Branch, Python — Private repo — My Existing Branch, Java — Public repo — New Branch, Java — Public repo — My Existing Branch, Java — Private repo — New Branch, Java — Private repo — My Existing Branch]
